text: Roger that Shay. Keep on rocking lets hope that we get to fiddle with the settings soon! :wink:

I guess the drag and drop editor is now included in all new professional and enterprise portals, and we're working on rolling it out to all existing portals over the next couple months. Question - will this replace the current drag/drop/coded email builder functionality on professional/enteprprise plans? How do you create custom branded templates with custom styles? <#CES6JU0RY|drag-drop-email-beta>
So i added a background image behind the title on this template but outlook 2016 doesnâ€™t render it. The link I sent although a bit hacky enables background images in outlook.
This is what the same email looks like on the <http://outlook.com|outlook.com> webclient
custom templates are not currently supported by the new drag n drop builder, but <@U24DCSJBE> has stated multiple times they plan to make it possible, no ETA.
I am not sure if this helps but I have built custom modules with the drag n drop builder for my team and applied my own styles to them.

Yeah, I've built out custom modules that can be used within the drag-and-drop email editor, without issue -- but I feel like something has changed within the past month. Previously, I could clone the original HS provided module element (i.e. the standard footer that comes in the drag and drop world) and create a customized version. Now all of those base HS modules seem to have vanished from my file manager
Hi Shay, thank you. i sent you a message :slightly_smiling_face:
